channel.title: Comments for Kotlin Blog
channel.description: Kotlin — programming language for the JVM by JetBrains

item.title: Comment on Use Kotlin with npm, webpack and react by Dmitry Jemerov
item.dc:creator: Dmitry Jemerov
item.description: You can ignore the "Unindexed Maven repositories" message. It does not prevent anything in the demo from working.
item.content:encoded: You can ignore the “Unindexed Maven repositories” message. It does not prevent anything in the demo from working.

item.title: Comment on Use Kotlin with npm, webpack and react by Ziustag
item.dc:creator: Ziustag
item.description:
With the Thinkter demo I'm having difficulties with the additional maven repositories:
Unindexed remote maven repositories found. Disable... The following repositories used in your gradle projects were not indexed yet: http://dl.bintray.com/kotlin/kotlinx.html https://dl.bintray.com/kotlin/squash http://dl.bintray.com/kotlin/ktor
I'm on Windows 10 with Intellij 17.2. If I try to manually update the missing repos, I get a strange error that only leads to some unresolved Intellij bug: nexus-maven-repository-index.properties does not exist https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-138029 https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-136065
Am I missing something? I tried quite a few things, but I don't seem to be able to solve that issue. It's quite a shame, since the demo seems very interesting to me.
item.content:encoded:
With the Thinkter demo I’m having difficulties with the additional maven repositories:

Unindexed remote maven repositories found. Disable…
The following repositories used in your gradle projects were not indexed yet:
http://dl.bintray.com/kotlin/kotlinx.html
https://dl.bintray.com/kotlin/squash
http://dl.bintray.com/kotlin/ktor

I’m on Windows 10 with Intellij 17.2. If I try to manually update the missing repos, I get a strange error that only leads to some unresolved Intellij bug:
nexus-maven-repository-index.properties does not exist
https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-138029
https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-136065

Am I missing something? I tried quite a few things, but I don’t seem to be able to solve that issue. It’s quite a shame, since the demo seems very interesting to me.

item.title: Comment on Kotlin/Native Tech Preview: Kotlin without a VM by 不使用虚拟机的 Kotlin | 神刀安全网
item.dc:creator: 不使用虚拟机的 Kotlin | 神刀安全网
item.description: […] 本文译自 Kotlin/Native Tech Preview: Kotlin without a VM […]
item.content:encoded: […] 本文译自 Kotlin/Native Tech Preview: Kotlin without a VM […]

item.title: Comment on Kotlin/Native Tech Preview: Kotlin without a VM by Sébastien Deleuze
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Deleuze
item.description: See also https://github.com/mbasso/asm-dom as a concrete example of such WASM + DOM interop example (will be updated to pure WASM without JS when supported)
item.content:encoded: See also https://github.com/mbasso/asm-dom as a concrete example of such WASM + DOM interop example (will be updated to pure WASM without JS when supported)

item.title: Comment on Kotlin/Native Tech Preview: Kotlin without a VM by Amir Abiri
item.dc:creator: Amir Abiri
item.description: What I love about this is the potential for standalone command-line tools. This is great for devops, as distribution of script-based or VM-based tools is difficult. Having a single binary that anyone can download (or can auto-update itself) is a huge advantage. Until now the only viable option in this area was GO.
item.content:encoded: What I love about this is the potential for standalone command-line tools. This is great for devops, as distribution of script-based or VM-based tools is difficult. Having a single binary that anyone can download (or can auto-update itself) is a huge advantage. Until now the only viable option in this area was GO.

item.title: Comment on Kotlin/Native Tech Preview: Kotlin without a VM by Fei
item.dc:creator: Fei
item.description: Currently I'm using Xamarin to do cross platform app development. One thing I don't like is its slow startup time. I wish Kotlin/Native can keep this as one of its performance goal.
item.content:encoded: Currently I’m using Xamarin to do cross platform app development. One thing I don’t like is its slow startup time. I wish Kotlin/Native can keep this as one of its performance goal.

item.title: Comment on Kotlin 1.1.2 is out by Dmitry Jemerov
item.dc:creator: Dmitry Jemerov
item.description: If downloading from the IDE doesn't work, you can use your Web browser to download the plugin from https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/6954-kotlin and then use Settings | Plugins | Install from disk to install it.
item.content:encoded: If downloading from the IDE doesn’t work, you can use your Web browser to download the plugin from https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/6954-kotlin and then use Settings | Plugins | Install from disk to install it.

item.title: Comment on Kotlin 1.1.2 is out by Jerry Destremps
item.dc:creator: Jerry Destremps
item.description:

item.content:encoded:
Can’t update Android Studio. All my co-workers are getting the same error for the past couple of days:

2017-04-27 17:47:40,940 [112178768] WARN – Settings.impl.PluginDownloader – Cannot download ‘http://plugins.jetbrains.com/pluginManager/?action=download&id=org.jetbrains.kotlin&build=AI-162.2228.14&uuid=fea061f2-e20e-47da-a230-b1374ea9f287’: Read timed out
, response: 200 OK
